metadata.description: Nestled in a dense pine forest with rolling hills, Whispering Pines offers a challenging championship-level course with a diverse mix of tight wooded fairways, strategic water crossings, and a few open bomber holes. The course features elevation changes on nearly every hole and requires a complete arsenal of shots to score well.
metadata.author: DiscCraft Designs

holes.description: A gentle opener with a slight right-to-left fairway through a corridor of pine trees. The fairway widens as you approach the basket, which is protected by two large pines on either side.

A challenging dogleg right that climbs uphill before revealing the basket on a plateau. Trees line both sides of the fairway, and the green slopes away on the far side, adding risk to aggressive approaches.
A dramatic downhill shot through a narrow gap in the trees. The basket sits in a small clearing, but is guarded by a small water hazard in front and dense trees behind.

A challenging par 4 with a narrow initial fairway that opens up midway. A creek crosses the fairway twice, requiring precise placement to avoid a penalty. The basket sits on a small mound with bunkers on either side.

A short but technical par 3 with multiple routes to the basket. Dense trees block the direct line, forcing players to choose between a tight right gap or a wider left hyzer line. The basket sits in a small depression surrounded by pine trees.

A monster par 5 that winds through a dense forest with strategic landing zones. Multiple tree islands create a multi-stage challenge, requiring placement over pure distance. Water guards the right side of the entire fairway.
A technical par 3 that forces an S-curve flight path around two large tree clusters. The fairway has a slight uphill grade, and the basket is protected by a grouping of three guardian trees.

A scenic par 4 that plays alongside a lake. The fairway curves gently to the right, with the basket positioned on a small peninsula extending into the water. Bold players might attempt to cut the corner over the water for a birdie look.

A picturesque uphill par 3 with the basket positioned on top of a rocky hill. Multiple tree clusters create windows that must be hit to reach the green. The hillside drops off steeply behind the basket, penalizing overthrows.
A dramatic downhill bomber hole with the basket visible from the tee. The fairway is mostly open, but large isolated trees dot the landscape and must be avoided. The green slopes from back to front.

A tight wooded par 4 with a low ceiling throughout. The fairway makes a gentle left turn and narrows as it approaches the basket. Multiple fallen logs create additional obstacles that must be navigated.

A moderate length par 3 with a split fairway offering two distinct routes to the basket. The left path is longer but more open, while the right path is shorter but requires threading a narrow gap. The basket sits on a small plateau.

A challenging par 4 with a blind shot around a dense cluster of trees. The fairway slopes down and to the left, with the basket positioned near a small pond. The green is fast and slopes toward the water.
A short but technical par 3 over a small ravine. Multiple mature trees guard the basket, creating small windows that must be hit. The green slopes down toward the ravine on the far side.

An epic par 5 with multiple elevation changes and fairway turns. Players must navigate a series of strategically placed tree clusters. The fairway narrows in the middle before opening up to a protected green surrounded by bunkers.

A scenic par 3 over a small pond. The basket is visible from the tee, but water completely guards the front of the green. A large tree on the right forces most shots to take the left-to-right line over the water.
A narrow par 4 through a dense pine alley. The fairway doglegs right midway, with the basket hidden until the corner is reached. Multiple trees create a tunnel effect for the entire hole.

A grand finale with the basket positioned on an island green. The fairway is open for the first half, then narrows as it approaches the water. A safe layup area exists before the water, but aggressive players can attempt to reach the island in one big throw.
